item.title: High memory instances
item.description: These instances are purpose-built to run large in-memory databases.

item.title: f1.4xlarge instances
item.description: Expands the range of the accelerated-computing F1 instance family with the introduction of f1.4xlarge instances.

item.title: Console support for scheduled scaling for Spot Fleet
item.description: Increase or decrease the current capacity of a fleet based on the date and time.

item.title: T3 instances
item.description: T3 instances are the next generation burstable general-purpose instance type that provide a baseline level of CPU performance with the ability to burst CPU usage at any time for as long as required.

item.title: Allocation strategies for EC2 Fleets and Spot Fleets
item.description: You can specify whether On-Demand capacity is fulfilled by price (lowest price first) or priority (highest priority first). You can specify the number of Spot pools across which to allocate your target Spot capacity.

item.title: R5, R5d, and z1d instances
item.description: These instances are ideal for running your memory-intensive applications.

item.title: Automate snapshot lifecycle
item.description: You can use Amazon Data Lifecycle Manager to automate creation and deletion of snapshots for your EBS volumes.

item.title: Launch Template CPU Options
item.description: When you create a launch template using the command line tools, you can optimize the CPU options to suit specific workloads.

item.title: Dedicated Host Tagging
item.description: You can assign custom tags to your Dedicated Hosts to categorize them in different ways.

item.title: Bare Metal Instances (i3.metal)
item.description: Bare metal instances provide your applications with direct access to the physical resources of the host server, such as processors and memory.

item.title: Optimize CPU Options
item.description: When you launch an instance, you can optimize the CPU options to suit specific workloads or business needs.

item.title: On-Demand Instances in Spot Fleets
item.description: You can include a request for On-Demand capacity in your Spot Fleet request to ensure that you always have instance capacity.

item.title: EC2 Fleet
item.description: You can use EC2 Fleet to launch a group of instances across different EC2 instance types and Availability Zones, and across On-Demand Instance, Reserved Instance, and Spot Instance purchasing models.
